text: The FBI should be allowed to thoroughly investigate allegations against Kavanaugh and interview key witnesses, and the White House must share any directives they’ve made to the FBI. The American people deserve to know. https://t.co/kHJQGfJ1R5
Thank you @JasonKander for your courage in confronting depression and PTSD. If you’re a veteran struggling with mental health challenges, the VA Crisis Line is 1–800–273–8255. https://t.co/E0kqt9aDyV

Happy birthday to my dear friend, @TheRevAl. As we fight for an optimistic vision of our future, I can’t think of an organization that does it with the kind of force and conviction of Rev and the leaders @NationalAction. https://t.co/g75MHiwsHh

The FBI report on Judge Kavanaugh is entirely incomplete and insufficient. There are dozens of witnesses who have not been interviewed. This is for a lifetime appointment. The American people deserve to have all the facts.
Today, I’m standing with everyone marching today to oppose Judge Kavanaugh’s nomination. The American people deserve better. https://t.co/6LCtuVDxKH

A federal judge has blocked the Trump admin’s attempt to revoke legal status from hundreds of thousands of immigrants fleeing disasters and violence. It is critical that these hundreds of thousands of immigrants who fled harm be protected. https://t.co/hACQ1EdDQi

I was honored to meet this afternoon with a survivor of sexual assault and the daughter of another survivor to listen to their stories. Their courage is extraordinary. Sexual assault impacts every race, every age, every gender. We must confront it. https://t.co/Q5QHbh1KyQ

It was a tremendous honor to serve as San Francisco District Attorney, and I was proud to support George Gascon as my successor. I'm sending George and his family my best wishes as he focuses on his mother’s health.

This morning, the Senate will vote on whether to move Judge Kavanaugh’s nomination forward. I will vote NO.
Hi all – staff here. Senator Harris is speaking on the Senate floor about Judge Kavanaugh right now. We'll be tweeting highlights from her remarks.
This process has left the American people with more questions than answers. This has not been a search for the truth. https://t.co/Q1nFw78U8L

Today is National Walk to a Park Day. I was proud to introduce legislation to strengthen opportunities for communities around the country to establish new parks and open spaces so that more children have a safe place to play and experience the outdoors.
 
https://t.co/Tfy3Ho982Y

As communities throughout the Florida Panhandle begin to recover from Hurricane Michael, I’m keeping all those affected in my thoughts and am particularly grateful for the first responders on the scene.

The anti-lynching bill I introduced with @SenBooker and @SenatorTimScott just passed out of the Judiciary Committee. We must speak the truth about our past. These were horrendous acts of violence motivated by racism. And victims and families never received justice. https://t.co/Gt4vU5FqfU

This outrageous attack on voting rights shows just how vital it is to restore the Voting Rights Act to full strength. Voting is a fundamental right, and we must secure it for every American.

In 2017, Latina women were paid on average 53 cents for every dollar paid to white males. Today, on Latina Equal Pay Day, it’s time to speak truth about the wage gap, call on employers to take steps to address it, and redouble our efforts to pass legislation to ensure fair pay.

This weekend, Americans of many faiths are gathering to send a message of strength and unity against the forces of anti-Semitism that continue to exist in this country. We have so much more in common than what separates us. #ShowUpForShabbat

A quick thread on federal judiciary nominee Thomas Farr, whose nomination is headed for a vote on the Senate floor. Farr is anti-voting rights, anti-worker and does not deserve a lifetime appointment. I remain ardently opposed to his nomination.
